result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy J Berge was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The defendant can pay $25 per month with the first payment due 3-1-16 and each subsequent payment will be due the 1st of every month until paid in full
.

from def   re: At Intake def was ordered to be on JSS monitoring for only14 days but bond does not reflect this.  Def has contact CRT's office but they see nothing that states this.  Def's Atty is in process of getting transcript.  Def has not violatied & has passed all tests.  Def has employment oppurtunity in which monitoring would not work.  Req CRT contact JSS & have def released from bond monitoring
Per TWB:  GPS was a condition of bond for an unspecified period.  Offender is represented by counsel & he should have her contact the Court
Order Directing Law Enforcement Assistance filed.

Def P
Doerfler: we have the CM case there's a N/C in that. She's protected for a time being & we can raise that later & will
CRT : there is no reaston to meet w/Atty Henderson since he has terminated her services, if she represents him in the future he can return to the exclusion zone so there's no need to modify the order at this time.

from Jeff, JSS   re: Def has hired Atty Kimberly Henderson in W Salem.  Her office is located w/in the exclusion zone for his child's daycare....for every appt def has w/ his lawyer, he has agreed to let JSS staff know ahead of time & agreed to provide verification from Ms. Henderson afterwards.  Please advise w/ any concerns
